headline: DOJ Probes Disney-FuboTV Deal Over Competition Concerns
summary: (Bloomberg) -- Antitrust officials at the US Justice Department are looking into Walt Disney Co.’s deal to take a controlling stake in streaming company FuboTV Inc., according to people familiar with the plans.Most Read from BloombergTrump Gives New York ‘One Last Chance’ to End Congestion FeeDOGE Visits National Gallery of Art to Discuss Museum’s Legal StatusThe Racial Wealth Gap Is Not Just About MoneyWhy Car YouTuber Matt Farah Is Fighting for Walkable CitiesBackyard Micro-Flats Aim to Ease S

headline: 4 Broadcast Radio & TV Stocks to Buy From a Prospering Industry
summary: Radio and television broadcast companies like NFLX, GTN, FOXA and TGNA benefit from higher content consumption and steady digital viewing despite intense competition for ad revenues.
